School.title: School
School.description: Represents a school within the CampusConnect platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the School entity.

udiseCode.description: Unique Identification Code for the school.

contactEmail.description: The contact email address of the school.

contactPhoneNumber.description: The contact phone number of the school.

adminName.description: The name of the school administrator.

Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student enrolled in a school. Admins should be able to create, read, update, and manage students.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Student entity.

admissionNumber.description: The admission number assigned to the student.

admissionDate.description: The date of admission of the student.

fullName.description: The full name of the student.

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the student.

parentGuardianName.description: The name of the student's parent or guardian.

aadhaarNumber.description: The Aadhaar number of the student (optional or masked for privacy).

admissionClass.description: The class the student was originally admitted to.

classSectionId.description: Reference to ClassSection, representing the student's CURRENT class and section. (Relationship: ClassSection 1:N Student)

pen.description: Personal Education Number of the student.

StudentTimelineEvent.title: StudentTimelineEvent
StudentTimelineEvent.description: Represents a single event in a student's timeline, like admission or promotion.

ClassSection.title: ClassSection
ClassSection.description: Represents a class and section within a school.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ClassSection entity.

className.description: The name of the class (e.g., Grade 1, Grade 2).

sectionIdentifier.description: The standard identifier for the section (e.g., A, B, C).

sectionName.description: The custom name of the section (e.g., Red, Blue, Green).

sectionInchargeId.description: Reference to Teacher who is in charge of the section. (Relationship: Teacher 1:N ClassSection)

Teacher.title: Teacher
Teacher.description: Represents a teacher in a school.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Teacher entity.

email.description: The email address of the teacher.

contactNumber.description: The contact phone number of the teacher.

qualification.description: The academic qualification of the teacher.

dateOfJoining.description: The date the teacher joined the school.

role.description: The role of the teacher in the school.

subject.description: The primary subject taught by the teacher.

Exam.title: Exam
Exam.description: Represents an exam conducted in a school.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Exam entity.

examName.description: The name of the exam (e.g., Midterm, Final).

className.description: The class for which the exam is conducted.

year.description: The academic year of the exam.

Subject.title: Subject
Subject.description: Represents a subject within an exam.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Subject entity.

maxMarks.description: Maximum marks for the subject in this exam.

examDate.description: The date of the exam for this subject.

MasterSubject.title: MasterSubject
MasterSubject.description: Represents a master subject for a school.

id.description: Unique identifier for the MasterSubject entity.

MasterClass.title: MasterClass
MasterClass.description: Represents a master class for a school (e.g., Grade 1, UKG).

id.description: Unique identifier for the MasterClass entity.

PerformanceRecord.title: PerformanceRecord
PerformanceRecord.description: Represents a student's performance record in a subject for a specific exam.

id.description: Unique identifier for the PerformanceRecord entity (e.g., studentId_subjectId).

marks.description: The marks obtained by the student in the subject.

remarks.description: Performance notes or remarks for the student.

ClassInchargeQuery.title: ClassInchargeQuery
ClassInchargeQuery.description: Represents a query raised by a section incharge against a student.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ClassInchargeQuery entity.

sectionInchargeId.description: Reference to Teacher (Section Incharge). (Relationship: Teacher 1:N ClassInchargeQuery)

query.description: The query raised by the section incharge.

reportResolution.description: The report or resolution for the query.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the query was raised.

Promotion.title: Promotion
Promotion.description: Represents the promotion of students from one class to another for a specific academic session.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support a multi-tenant School Management SaaS application (CampusConnect). Each school operates independently, with data isolation achieved through path-based ownership. Every school's data is stored under a dedicated `/schools/{schoolId}` path, which serves as the root for all school-specific data. This design ensures that security rules can easily enforce access control based on the school ID.  

**Authorization Independence (Denormalization):** To ensure authorization independence and enable atomic operations, the `schoolId` is denormalized into every subcollection document (e.g., `students`, `classSections`, `teachers`, etc.).  This avoids the need for `get()` calls in security rules to verify school ownership, as the `schoolId` is directly available in each document.

**Structural Segregation (Homogeneous Security Posture):** Each collection is dedicated to a single entity type, ensuring that all documents within a collection share the same security requirements.  For example, students are stored in `/schools/{schoolId}/students/{studentId}`, teachers in `/schools/{schoolId}/teachers/{teacherId}`, etc.  This segregation simplifies security rules and prevents accidental exposure of sensitive data.

**Access Modeling:**
*   **Path-Based Ownership:**  The primary access control mechanism is path-based ownership.  Each entity (student, teacher, classSection, etc.) is owned by a specific school, determined by the `schoolId` in the path.  Security rules can then easily verify that the authenticated user has the appropriate permissions within that school.
*   **Hierarchical Paths:** The structure utilizes hierarchical paths to represent `1:N` relationships. For example, `/schools/{schoolId}/classSections/{classSectionId}/exams/{examId}` clearly represents that a `School` has many `ClassSections`, and each `ClassSection` has many `Exams`.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** The structure supports secure `list` operations by enforcing that the `schoolId` is always present and validated in security rules.  This prevents unauthorized listing of data across different schools, as the query must specify a valid `schoolId`.

**DBAC:** Permissions are based on `request.auth.uid` and database content only.  For instance, a teacher's access to student performance data is determined by their association with the school and class section, as stored in the database, not by custom claims.

The structure effectively balances security, scalability, and debuggability, aligning with the core design principles and strategy mandates.
